analyzed: dbyug pa ral gri 'khor lo g-yas na 'dzin //
translated: He holds in his right hands a club, sword, and chakram,

original: sdigs mdzub ral gri dgra sta g-yon na mda' //
analyzed: sdigs mdzub ral gri dgra sta g-yon na mda' //
translated: And in his left hands a threatening forefinger, sword, and battle-ax.

original: rdo rje dbyug sngon can la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyug sngon can la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Vajra-Niladanda.

original: gtum chen gnag dmar dkar ba'i zhal gsum mnga' //üîΩdbyug pa ral gri 'khor lo phyag g-yas 'dzin //
analyzed: gtum chen gnag dmar dkar ba'i zhal gsum mnga' // dbyug pa ral gri 'khor lo phyag g-yas 'dzin //
translated: With three faces, black, red, and white, he is greatly fierce,üîΩHolding in his right hands a club, sword, and chakram,

original: sdigs mdzub ral gri dgra sta g-yon na bsnams //
analyzed: sdigs mdzub ral gri dgra sta g-yon na bsnams //
translated: And in his left hands a threatening forefinger, sword, and battle-ax.

original: rdo rje stobs po che la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje stobs po che la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Vajra-Mahabala.

original: sdo dmar dkar ba'i zhal mnga' khro bo'i gtso //
analyzed: sdo dmar dkar ba'i zhal mnga' khro bo'i gtso //
translated: With faces blue, red, and white, he is the chief of wrathful ones,

original: rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis spyi bor gtsug tor 'dzin //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis spyi bor gtsug tor 'dzin //
translated: His two principal hands holding a ushnisha on his head,

original: gzhan rnams rdo rje padma sdigs mdzub gri //
analyzed: gzhan rnams rdo rje padma sdigs mdzub gri //
translated: And the others a vajra, lotus, threatening forefinger, and sword.

original: rdo rje gtsug tor rgyal la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje gtsug tor rgyal la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Vajra-Ushnisha-Chakravarta.

original: gnag dmar dkar ba'i zhal ldan khro rgyal ni //
analyzed: gnag dmar dkar ba'i zhal ldan khro rgyal ni //
translated: With faces black, red, and white, he is a wrathful king,

original: rdo rje 'khor lo nor bu phyag g-yas 'chang //
analyzed: rdo rje 'khor lo nor bu phyag g-yas 'chang //
translated: Holding in his right hands a vajra, chakram, and jewel,

original: g-yon pa sdigs mdzub zhags pa padma gri //
analyzed: g-yon pa sdigs mdzub zhags pa padma gri //
translated: And in his left hands a threatening forefinger, lasso, lotus, and sword.

original: rdo rje gnod mdzes rgyal la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje gnod mdzes rgyal la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Vajra Acala.

original: dkyil 'khor mtshor gnas lha sku'i me to gsum cu rtsa gnyis la //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mtshor gnas lha sku'i me to gsum cu rtsa gnyis la //
translated: The thirty-two deities of the mandala, the body of the deity, are the lotus lake.

original: rab dang bung bas bstod pa'i lces blangs dge chen sbrang rtsi @117a * //
analyzed: rab dang bung bas bstod pa'i lces blangs dge chen sbrang rtsi @117a * //
translated: The praise of the bees is the tongue that takes the great virtue honey.

original: 'di ; /'gro ba dngos 'dzin rlung nad gzer ba rnams kyis legs bsten pas //
analyzed: 'di ; /'gro ba dngos 'dzin rlung nad gzer ba rnams kyis legs bsten pas //
translated: By this, those who are afflicted by the wind disease of grasping at real things in the world,üîΩmay the torment of afflictions be removed, and having increased the luster of benefit for others, may they attain the wisdom body.

original: nyon mongs gdung bsal gzhan don mdangs rgyas ye shes sku thob shog / dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i sku la bstod pa zhes bya ba rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug mi gnas rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: nyon mongs gdung bsal gzhan don mdangs rgyas ye shes sku thob shog / dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha'i sku la bstod pa zhes bya ba rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug mi gnas rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The praise called The Body of the Deities of the Mandala of Glorious Guhyasamaja composed by the lord of yogis, Anupamarakshita, is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po a'a ts'arya shraddh'a ka ra warma dang zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ba nde rin chen bzad pos ba sgyur ba'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po a'a ts'arya shraddh'a ka ra warma dang zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ba nde rin chen bzad pos ba sgyur ba'o//
translated: The Indian abbot Acharya Shraddhakara Varman and the great translator Vade Rinchen Zhepa translated it.
